title: Jefferson National Expansion Memorial: Films
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Films               Films      While visiting the Gateway Arch, see Monument To The Dream, the award-winning film that documents the construction of the magnificent Gateway Arch. Viewing of the film is included in the $3 entrance and $10 Journey to the Top tickets. Film is free for children 15 and under or with the America the Beautiful pass, however, timed tickets are still needed to enter the Arch facility.Please note: There are no more reservations accepted for the film Monument to the Dream. At the Old Courthouse, learn about the story of early St. Louis and its role as a trade and transportation mecca in the film Slavery on Trial: The Dred Scott Decision. There is no charge for this film which will be shown in the Dred Scott gallery starting April 2015. In addition to the Dred Scott film, now showing in the gallery Exploring the West is the 10 minute video Lewis and Clark, Preparation for the Expedition.This film explains the reasons behind the journey and what was discovered along the way. Find information about accessibility for visitors with disabilities.
